anchoring.content:

who sings gone gone gone she been gone so long
I will provide you with several retrieved passages:
Passages:
['"Gone" is a song by British singer Charli XCX and French singer Christine and the Queens. It was released on 17 July 2019 as the third single from Charli XCX\'s upcoming third studio album "Charli". The music video was released alongside the track.\n', '"So Gone" is a song by American R&B recording artist Monica. It was one out of several tracks rapper-producer Missy Elliott wrote and produced along with Kenneth Cunningham and Jamahl Rye from production duo Spike & Jamahl for Monica\'s fourth studio album, "After the Storm" (2003), following the delay and subsequent reconstruction of her 2002 album, "All Eyez on Me". Incorporating elements of hip hop and 1970s-style smooth jazz as well as soul music, it features a sample from the 1976 song "You Are Number One", penned by Zyah Ahmonuel and performed by The Whispers.\n', '"She\'s Gone Gone Gone" is a country music song written by Harlan Howard and originally recorded by American singer Lefty Frizzell. Frizzell\'s version of the song reached number 12 on the "Billboard" Hot Country Singles & Tracks chart.\n', '"She\'s So Gone", performed by Naomi Scott, also peaked on the Bubbling Under Hot 100 Singles at number 3.\n', '"She\'s Gone" is a song by the American rock band Steelheart, from their 1990 self-titled debut album. The\n']

question_info.question: who sings gone gone gone she been gone so long
passages:
"Gone" is a song by British singer Charli XCX and French singer Christine and the Queens. It was released on 17 July 2019 as the third single from Charli XCX's upcoming third studio album "Charli". The music video was released alongside the track.
"So Gone" is a song by American R&B recording artist Monica. It was one out of several tracks rapper-producer Missy Elliott wrote and produced along with Kenneth Cunningham and Jamahl Rye from production duo Spike & Jamahl for Monica's fourth studio album, "After the Storm" (2003), following the delay and subsequent reconstruction of her 2002 album, "All Eyez on Me". Incorporating elements of hip hop and 1970s-style smooth jazz as well as soul music, it features a sample from the 1976 song "You Are Number One", penned by Zyah Ahmonuel and performed by The Whispers.
"She's Gone Gone Gone" is a country music song written by Harlan Howard and originally recorded by American singer Lefty Frizzell. Frizzell's version of the song reached number 12 on the "Billboard" Hot Country Singles & Tracks chart.
"She's So Gone", performed by Naomi Scott, also peaked on the Bubbling Under Hot 100 Singles at number 3.
"She's Gone" is a song by the American rock band Steelheart, from their 1990 self-titled debut album. The
